alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jefferson; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 3:40PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lincoln, southeastern Jefferson, northeastern Franklin and southwestern Copiah Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 339 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Union Church, or 13 miles northeast of Meadville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pleasant Hill around 350 PM CDT. Caseyville around 355 PM CDT. Allen and Loyd Star around 400 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for southwestern Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, south central and southwestern Mississippi.
